content.description:
A fantastic line that can be a bit deceiving. 

P1: Start up lower angle ice that steepens and narrows drastically as you pull up into the narrow gully/chimney out of sight of your belayer. Pull up through some steep, thin, and hard to protect ice using whatever trick you've got (back against the rock works well) to gain a large snow ledge with a bolted belay immediately on your left. Bring your partner up and walk across the snow ledge.

P2: Climb the stepped curtains of ice to an ice cave with a bolted belay on the right.

P3: Climb the remaining ice as it narrows and eases off to a bolted belay with rap rings.

Descent: One 70m rappel gets you to the snow ledge, walk across the snow ledge back to the P1 belay with rap rings and rap to ground.

Note it is possible to do this in two pitches with a 70m rope stretching first pitch, we did it in two by accident having missed the obvious bolted anchor at the top of P1 and continuing to an ice belay on the top of the first ice step and to the left on P2.

Found in Planter's Valley, from the Devil's Gap parking point hike along the obvious wide trail until you've passed one valley (where Wicked Wanda is found), once the second valley (Planter's) is on your left look for a narrow trail. Cut onto this narrow trail and work your way through the forest which gradually transitions to rocky creek bed. Tediously navigate your way over rocks until you see Anorexia Nervosa on your left, and Weathering Heights straight ahead and slightly to the right. ~1.5 hours from the car.
~10 screws, bolted belays.

Not sure of the route name, it might be The Peanut Gallery? Heard it could be WI4 but it was WI3 when we climbed it. If anyone has info I will fix the page. Several more pitches can be found above the first pitches by walking up the mountain



Past Anorexia Nervosa and Weathering Heights in the end of the gully

Screws

A fantastic 2 pitches of quality ice. Climb up 50 meters of steep ice to where the angle of the ice eases off a bit and you can build a somewhat sheltered belay. Bring your partner up and finish the remaining 50 meters on easier ice that winds a little up top to a tree with obvious rap tat. Two 50 meter rappels get you to the ground (first off the tree, second off a v thread).

Found in Planter's Valley, from the Devil's Gap parking point hike along the obvious wide trail until you've passed one valley (where Wicked Wanda is found), once the second valley (Planter's) is on your left look for a narrow trail. Cut onto this narrow trail and work your way through the forest which gradually transitions to rocky creek bed. Tediously navigate your way over rocks until you see Anorexia Nervosa on your left, and Weathering Heights straight ahead and slightly to the right. ~1.5 hours from the car.
10-14 screws and cordage for v threads. No bolted belays.
